meanings.definition: A structure for conveying smoke or hot gases from a fire, typically vertical and made of brick or metal.
meanings.sent1: The chimbleys on the old house were tall and made of red bricks.
meanings.sent2: The chimney sweep climbed up to clean the chimbleys on the roof.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest in the chimbleys, thinking it was a cozy spot.
meanings.sent4: The chimbleys stood like sentinels, guarding the house from the cold.
meanings.sent5: The smoke billowed out of the chimbleys, painting the sky gray.

meanings.definition: The opening in a chimney through which smoke and gases pass.
meanings.sent1: Santa Claus climbed down the chimbleys to deliver presents.
meanings.sent2: The soot from the chimbleys stained the walls around the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The cat peeked out of the chimbleys, surprising the family below.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the house escaped through the chimbleys, carried away by the wind.
meanings.sent5: The warmth from the fire escaped through the chimbleys, heating the cold night air.
